explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though distearyldimethylammonium chloride (C38H80ClN), a main component of commercial products, is classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to substances which begin to decompose at temperatures lower than the test temperatures are not available (distearyldimethylammonium chloride (C38H80ClN), a main component of commercial products, decomposes at 135degC, which is lower than the melting point (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing chlorine bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available (distearyldimethylammonium chloride (C38H80ClN), a main component of commercial products, decomposes at 135degC, which is lower than the melting point (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 55degC).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 11,300mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD TG404 (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005)): 72 hour application of the substance (the test material content: 97%) "showed no evidence of irritation."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD TG405 (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005)): "severe irritation." Although classified as Category 1-2A in the absence of data on reversibility, the substance should be placed in Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on three epidemiological case reports that provide no evidence of skin sensitization in humans (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005)) along with negative results of guinea pig skin sensitization tests performed according to Maximization Method.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ/somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and germ/somatic cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (several indices), described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005) and SIDS (1996).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of reduced fertility of parental animals and reduced viability of pups at doses producing parental toxicity (or in the absence of data on parental toxicity) in rat reproductive toxicity studies and mouse teratogenicity studies, described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.78 (2005).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours LC50=0.16mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=13(CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
